Creating a header in markdown

{% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

markdown_header[source]

markdown_header(text:str, template:Template=<string.Template object at 0x7feb87164370>)

Returns a markdown header for a given text.

Parameters

text : str Text for the header. template : string template The template that defines the appearance of the header, and in which text will be embedded.

Returns

out : str Markdown-compatible text.

{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
py2gift.util.render_latex(markdown_header('Header 1'))
{% endraw %}

Markdown from a question

An example numerical question...

{% raw %} 
question_settings = {
    'name': 'Q1',
    'class': 'Numerical',
    'statement': 'Consider the constellation\nsample_images/1D_3_elements.svg',
    'solution': {
        'value': 42,
        'error': '10%'
    },
    'feedback': 'We need to...'
}
class_name = gift_wrapper.question.user_settings_to_class_init(question_settings)
numerical_question = getattr(gift_wrapper.question, class_name)(**question_settings)
{% endraw %}

...and one of multiple choice

{% raw %} 
question_settings = {
    'name': 'Q2',
    'class': 'MultipleChoice',
    'statement': 'Choose...',
    'answers':{
        'perfect': 'yep',
        'wrong': ['foo', 'fa']
    },
    'feedback': 'We need to...'
}
class_name = gift_wrapper.question.user_settings_to_class_init(question_settings)
multiple_choice_question = getattr(gift_wrapper.question, class_name)(**question_settings)
{% endraw %}

Decorating a gift-wrapper question to process paths svg files

{% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

class SvgToMarkdown[source]

SvgToMarkdown(decorated:Union[HtmlQuestion, QuestionDecorator]) :: QuestionDecorator

Decorator to reformat svg files for including them in markdown strings.

{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
decorated_numerical_question = SvgToMarkdown(numerical_question)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
py2gift.util.render_latex(decorated_numerical_question.to_markdown())
{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

settings_to_markdown[source]

settings_to_markdown(settings:dict)

Returns a markdown representation of the question given the corresponding settings.

Parameters

settings : dict User settings (usually read from a YAML file).

Returns

markdown: str Markdown representation

{% endraw %}
